description: Users are experiencing issues where the weather is no longer displayed on their calendars in Microsoft Outlook. Additionally, when calendar items are sourced from other senders, the meeting body is set to read-only, limiting user interaction. These symptoms have emerged following the installation of patches for the Microsoft Outlook spoofing vulnerability released on August 8, 2023, and the security feature bypass vulnerability released on July 11, 2023, leading to blocked images and hyperlinks.
